line.en: 'Good morning!'
Early in the morning, the doorbell chimed, so I\nwent to open it, and there I saw Ageha.
'What are you doing here?'
'So, you really are the dorm mother?'
she remarked as she saw me wearing an apron.
'...This place, it's the 'Witch's Mansion', isn't\nit?'
'It's a student dormitory for our school, huh?'
Ageha focused on the words 'student dormitory' as\nif questioning their suitability, as she gazed at\nthe magnificent entrance.
'I was surprised too. To think that I would\nbecome the caretaker of the place that we used to\nsneak into when we were kids.'
'It's nice... I might like to live here too.'
'If I were living here with you, Aoi, it would\ndefinitely be fun!'
'Why did you come here?'
I asked while guessing that perhaps she had come\nto invite me to walk to school with her.
She is, after all, my number one best friend.
'Ummm... Oh yeah! I came to ask Kotori to come to\nschool with me.'
I was wrong.
'Miss Allule?'
'Who's Miss Allule?'
'...No, it's nothing.'
While blushing due to the misunderstanding, I\nlooked back towards Kotori's room.
'Looks like she still hasn't woken up.'
Even if she gets up now and takes her time eating\nbreakfast, she can still make it with time to\nspare.
'I see. Alright, I'll wait here.'
'Thanks for the food.'
'There's still some left.'
'Hmm... Sorry but... I can't eat this much so\nearly in the morning.'
'You're joking, right? I only gave you a little\nbit.'
'...Even people in sports clubs don't eat a huge\nbowl of Neapolitan pasta in the morning!'
'Oh... yeah, I guess...'
Kanako ate the whole thing again this morning\nthough.
'...How was the taste?'
'It was tasty.'
'Really?'
'Yeah. Really. But there was a lot of it, so I\ngot tired of eating it halfway through.'
'With good food, it tastes good no matter how\nmuch you eat.'
'You've always had an unrefined palate, haven't\nyou?'
An unrefined palate!
The shock hit me like a bolt of lightning.
I hung my head in dismay.
'Why are you so shocked...?'
'The truth is...'
Ageha had revealed the reason why, since\nyesterday, the boarders hadn't been eating my\ncooking properly.
I thought I'd ask her opinion, which is why I\nmade Ageha some food and got her to eat it. It\nwas made from leftover ingredients anyway.
'...Eating things like pork fried with ginger, or\nNeapolitan pasta in the morning... It's unlikely\nthat girls would ever accept that kind of food.'
'What about something more refreshing? If you're\ngonna make pasta, why not try tomato sauce or\nJapanese style?'
'Cooking for girls is so difficult...'
Boy or girl, we're all human! Tasty is tasty!
That's what I believed.
Just as I was seriously troubled by this, I heard\nthe squeaking of turning wheels coming from down\nthe hallway.
First, Hat the duck came into the dining hall,\nthen Kotori came in after him. It's the opposite\nof what usually occurs.
'Why do I have to...yawn...'
Kotori rubbed her sleepy eyes and started\npreparing Hat's food.
It somehow looked as if the hungry Hat had woken\nher up.
'There, eat your fill and get nice and fat.\nSooner or later, I'm gonna eat you.'
'Quaaaaaack!'
Not understanding her words, Hat quacks happily\nas Kotori speaks to him, and eats his food.
'It's a duck, how cute!'
Kotori notices that Ageha is here and instantly\nopens up her eyes.
'This is a pet duck, isn't it? I've seen one in a\nTV commercial! Is it yours, Kotori?'
'He just decided to live in my room, that's all.\n...Why are you here?'
'Kotori, you've been absent from school for too\nlong. I came to see how you are doing. Do you\nfeel better now?'
'The teacher or someone asked you to do this,\ndidn't they?'
'No, they didn't actually. Hey, shall we go to\nschool together?'
'Who'd wanna go with you?'
Kotori gave a 'Hmph!' and made another one of\nthose straight faces she's so good at.
'But if you take too much time off, you'll get\nbehind in the lessons...'
'I don't think it has anything to do with you.'
'Well, that's true. You're right, I'm sorry.'
'...Who said I was taking a day off today?'
'Huh?'
'Don't get the wrong idea. The reason I'm going\nisn't just because you asked me to!'
'Ok then! Alright, I'll wait for you.'
'I never said I was going with you! I'll go by\nmyself.'
Kotori said with a straight face, then turned her\nwheelchair around.
Just as she was about to leave, she stopped the\nwheelchair and turned around.
'...You two, do you know each other?'
'Huh? Yeah, we're childhood friends.'
'Hmmm... What a pair of idiots.'
'...It looks like she has an even worse attitude\nthis morning.'
However, she did say she was going to go to\nschool.
After tidying up the breakfast things, I left the\ndormitory with Ageha.
On our way to school, somehow our conversation\nreturned to Kotori.
'Is there a reason why Kotori stopped coming to\nschool?'
'Yeah, I guess there is.'
'Kotori has a walking disability, right? When we\njoined the same class in the second grade, it\nseemed like she wasn't really in to it.'
'Sometimes, I would speak to her.'
That's so like Ageha to worry about that sort of\nthing.
If there are any people who don't really fit into\nthe group, or are left out, she won't just ignore\nthem.
In the past, that's why I started to play with\nMa-bou, so it could've been for the same reason.
'But for Kotori to be like that, to put it\nbluntly, it seems like she doesn't really want to\nfit in.'
'Yeah... I can imagine that somehow.'
'When the other girls in the class saw me with\nKotori like that, they'd get angry. That's when\nthey started to object to Kotori.'
'It became a big battle of the girls in the class\nVs. Kotori.'
When Ageha reminded herself of what happened back\nthen, she wearily slouched forward.
Ageha is cheerful and has many friends.
Kotori, who didn't respond to Ageha's concerns\nabout her, might have been seen as the one in the\nwrong by those around them.
'Since then, she stopped coming to school?'
'That's right.'
'You know, back then, Kotori was amazing. She\nfaced up to all of the girls in the class, and\ndidn't back down at all.'
Ageha is waving her arms around like someone from\na kung-fu movie, and passionately tells the\nstory.
...I decide not to ask her what kind of heroic\ndeeds took places, or for any specific details.
'(Well, I didn't expect that.)'
Even just by saying something in a slightly harsh\nway, she gets all tearful.
'Why did Kotori come to our school?'
'You know, she doesn't enjoy the lessons and\ndoesn't try to make any friends.'
The only reason I could think of that was likely\nwas because it has full disabled access.
In fact, that could be the main reason.
'Sheesh... I've gotta do something about this...'

Looking at Ageha from the side as she puts her
hands behind her head and starts thinking things
over, I remember the withdrawal notice that I
picked up last night.
In the spur of the moment, I decided not to give\nit back and acted like I knew nothing about it.
'(Is she really planning to drop out?)'
Hmm...
It somehow felt like I had picked up some heavy\npiece of lost property.
The two of us both made troubled faces as we\nwalked.
Murmur murmur...
A quiet, strange commotion surrounded us.
Most of the other students around us on their way\nto school were looking in the same direction.
Over there was...
a tall, slender, beautiful girl walking along.
'Oh, it's her.'
It was the girl I met in the garage.
Everyone was looking at her with curiosity, but\nit seemed that she hadn't noticed that other\npeople were looking at her.
I was looking at her in the same way as everyone\nelse, but Ageha took the way I was looking the\nwrong way...
'Ho ho! As I thought, you have high standards!'
'That girl is really famous in our school, the\nSuper Repeat Student, Amane Mochizuki-senpai!'
'Super Repeat Student??'
'Yeah. She's repeated the same school year\nseveral times.'
'Is she that stupid?'
She doesn't look it though.
'If I had to say one way or the other, I'd say\nshe's a genius.'
'It's way beyond the level of her having the best\nscores or anything like that, rather,'
'the teachers have nothing more to teach her, in\nfact, they sometimes go to learn from her, it\nseems.'
Smarter than the teachers?
'Despite that, she doesn't graduate and stays in\nschool. She plans a way to drop credits and\nintentionally repeats the year.'
'Originally, she was repeating the year for more\ntimes than the school rules allow, so that's why\nshe's the Super Repeat Student.'
'But, it's strange... To see her on her way to\nschool in the morning...'
I don't know if she is a genius or not, but she\ndefinitely seems like a pretty weird person.
Then, abruptly, Super Repeat Student Amane\nMochizuki-senpai stopped walking and looked up at\nthe sky.
Everyone else mimicked her and looked up too.
A jet plane, flying through the blue sky, pulling\nits vapor trail along behind it.
Everyone soon realized it was a plane and quickly\nlost interest and started walking again.
However, Amane Mochizuki kept on standing there,\nlooking up at the plane flying high in the sky.
When people came from behind and avoided her like\nshe was in their way, she didn't pay any\nattention to them either.
'Let's go.'
'Sure.'
Kotori arrived just as our morning homeroom class\nfinished.
'...Sorry I'm late.'
'Kotori, do you feel better now?'
'Yes, thankfully.'
'I see. I was worried about you.'

Kotori went past the homeroom teacher, who seemed
bewildered that she had come back to school all
of a sudden, then, still in her wheelchair,
arrived at her desk.
The desk right at the front was the only one that\ndidn't have a chair.
Everyone looked on, puzzled.
'...I'm not an animal in a zoo.'
Now that Kotori was in school, she started her\n'cool allure' routine again.
She concentrated during the lesson and answered\nthe teacher's questions easily when asked.
It seems like her grades in regular subjects are\nat the top of the class.
During recess, she sat at her desk, reading a\nbook, or going off somewhere.
She didn't try to talk to anyone, and even if\nAgeha tried to speak to her, she acted like she\nhadn't noticed.
The other girls in the class looked like they\nwere worried about how they should treat her and\nwatched her from a distance.
During gym class, the way she looked on, bored,\nleft an impression on me.
She always looked like she was all alone, and\ndidn't seem to be enjoying herself very much.
'Hey...! Kotori!'
'Erk!'
At lunchtime, I found Kotori, carrying her bag,\nabout to leave the classroom, and I chased her\ndown the hallway.
'It's lunchtime, you know?' What're you doing?'
Whoooosh!!
Suddenly, Kotori sped away at an unbelievable\nspeed!
'Wha... Hey!'
In the heat of the moment, I tried to chase her\nbut I thought I would bump into passing students,\nand I was too slow to start moving.
In the meantime, Kotori had already gotten inside\nthe elevator.
According to the school rules, most students are\nnot allowed to use the elevator.
It was only supposed to be used by workers or\nteachers carrying big loads, or disabled students\nlike Kotori.
Even so, I chased after her, only for the doors\nto close mercilessly in front of me.
'Bleeegh!'

Through the glass, the one with the
self-proclaimed 'cool allure' stuck her tongue
out and headed to the floor below, as I stood and
watched.
'...You're not getting away!'
'Huff, puff, puff...'
I ran and made it to the school gates.
She was holding her bag.
It seemed like she was trying to leave early, so\nI went to cut her off.
However, I can't deny the possibility that her\nlunch is in the bag.
'...Maybe I got the wrong idea.'
If that's not it, then what could be the problem?
I watched over the school gates like some\nguardian statue.
...BAM!
Something crashed into me from behind. In other\nwords, it came from outside the school gates.
'Aaargh!'
'Whoa!!'
'Ouch... What was that??'
I got up and felt like I was crawling out from\nunder an avalanche.
Then, I saw a big cardboard box and a girl that\nhad fallen over.
'A...are you OK!?'
'Ow ow ow... I'm OK.'
'I'm sorry but I couldn't see in front of me\nbecause of this box I was carrying.'
I looked at her as I got up and, without\nthinking, I thought I was going to say 'The Super\nRepeat Student!' but I held my tongue.
'How about you? You're not hurt are you?'
'I'm alright.'
'I see. That's good.'
As she says that, the Super-Repeating\nSuper-Senpai holds onto the big cardboard box.
'Uunnnh... my stomach...'
She went to lift the box up, but then Amane\nMochizuki-senpai slumped down, exhausted.
'...Due to an empty stomach, my short-term\nperformance has been significantly reduced.'
'I'll help you carry it. ...Huh? It's so heavy!!'
The big cardboard box is incredibly heavy.
'It's fine. I can carry it by myself.'
'C'mon, it's no big deal.'
I said as I went to pick up it anyway.
'Whew... Thanks.'
'Is this OK here?'
I don't know what's in it but we put the heavy\ncardboard box on the floor.
'...Sorry about that. Thanks for helping.'
'It's alright. Anyway senpai, if you're\nhungry...'
She was staring inside of the garage.
'Senpai?'
I find myself copying her and looking in the same\ndirection.
Inside...
...was Kotori.
'What is she doing here...?'
She's by the big thing placed in the center of\nthe garage, and is trying to lift up the sheet to\nsee what's underneath.
'Are you interested in that?'
Kotori is surprised when Amane speaks to her.
Kotori seems intimidated and nods...
Amane vigorously pulls back the sheet.
Inside is a white, streamlined aircraft.
Kotori looked at it, dazed.
I say 'Wow...' as I let a small, surprised sound\nslip out.
'Could this be...a glider?'
'Yes, it is.'
Amane nodded and Kotori cautiously moved her head\ncloser to the aircraft.
Even in the dimly lit garage, the glider's white\nbody had a glossy shine to it, and it faintly\nreflected Kotori's face.
I moved towards it, to take a closer look.
'...Is this, the one that we saw from Windmill\nHill?'
'Yeah, it could be...'
The smooth surface looks like it was made from\nplastic. However, it is hard to the touch.
The wings had been removed and for now, it was\njust the body.
'So this is what the cockpit's like.'
'This is amazing...'
'Yeah...'
'...Huuuuuh!!?'
We started talking to each other as some point,\nbut hadn't realized who it was that we were\ntalking to until now.
'Hey you, why were you running away just now?'
She calmly ignores my question but then hurriedly\ntries to escape, so I go ahead to block her.
'I won't let you get away!'
'Hrrrnnnn...'
'Why did you come here for? You're not here to\neat lunch...are you?'
'Hmph! There was some mean guy guarding the\nschool gates, so I came to hide in here!'
So she really was trying to leave early.
'Do you know her?'
Amane was listening carefully to our\nconversation.
'Slurp slurp...munch munch... This tastes good!'

Amane was wolfing down a Neapolitan pasta
lunchbox, and Kotori and I both had a face that
seemed to say 'Whoooaaa...' and looked on in
amazement.
Why would we say 'Whoooaaa...'?
'Well, to see such a beautiful girl do something\nlike that, I felt really disappointed...'
She didn't know that when she was eating ice\ncream like a crazy idiot, I had the same reaction\nwhen I was watching her.
By the way, the thing that Amane was eating was\nthe lunchbox that I had brought.
As usual, the boarders hadn't eaten the breakfast\nI had made for them, so I packed it as my lunch.
I had made two lunchboxes.
One was for me.

As for the other one, I thought that if Kotori
was going to go to school, she might have found
it difficult at lunchtime, so I was worried about
her and brought another lunchbox.
That's why I was chasing after her.
If she didn't need it, I thought that I might eat\nthem both myself, but she ran away before I could\neven ask her.
'But is this OK? For me to eat your whole\nlunchbox.'
asked Amane, although she'd already eaten most of\nit before asking.
'I've already eaten mine.'
I was hungry during morning recess, so I had\nlunch early.
Relieved to hear my answer, Amane continues to\nenjoy the cold Neapolitan pasta.
'Woo! This is delicious. It's been a while since\nI had proper food like this.'
'Didn't you have anything to eat after I saw you\nyesterday?'
I only gave her one piece of bread.
Amane stopped moving her chopsticks and took a\ngood look at my face.
'...Could it be that you're the person who gave\nme that bread yesterday?'
'You've only now just realized!!?'
'Well, I was concentrating on something\nyesterday.'
She really is weird!
'Oh, I see. So, this is the second time you've\nsaved me?'
She looked at me with eyes that sparkled like a\nlittle kid's.
If she were a dog, her tail would definitely be\nwagging like crazy.
'...I received that bread from you approximately\n20 hours ago, prior to that, the last meal I had\neaten was roughly 70 hours earlier.'
I counted on my fingers.
If there are 24 hours in a day...
'That's three days ago!!'
'I went to Taiyouken and ate pork ramen with all\nthe toppings. The soup was rich and delicious...'
She recalls this and her face looks like she's\nabout to start drooling.
'Why don't you eat? Are you on a diet?'
'Hmmmm...I forgot.'
'Huh?'
'When I'm thinking about something, I forget\nabout everything else. That's because I'm\nstupid.'
Amane replied with pride.
I'd prefer it if she didn't compare it to when\npeople forget things because they're hungry...
'Umm...Are you building this glider?'
'Yeah.'
'Are you doing that... here?'
'The Soaring Club use this garage as a\nclubhouse.'
'Soaring Club?'
I wasn't familiar with that name.
'What's 'soaring'?'
'Soaring is to fly a glider by riding the rising\nair currents.'
Flying a glider by riding the rising air\ncurrents...I kind of get it, but on the other\nhand, I don't get it.
'So the aim of the club is to make and fly a\nglider?'
'Well, yeah, that's right.'
So this garage is used for club activities after\nall.
Even so, it's pretty spacious.
'A glider is like an airplane, isn't it? Is it\nsomething you can make yourself...?'
'Yeah, I can make it. Because it's a man-made\nobject, there's no reason why you can't make it,\nright'
I have a feeling that's not what she's asking.
However, Amane answered the question in a totally\nserious manner.
'How do you make it?'
'Well, ah...rather than explaining it, it is\nquicker if you actually make one yourself.'
'Hold on a moment!' I said as Amane slurped up\nthe last of the Neapolitan with extremely bad\nmanners.
Wiping round her mouth with a tissue, she started\nrummaging through a desk drawer.
'Hmm... Where did that thing go?'
Peeking inside the drawer, somehow I get the\nimpression that Amane is a typical disorganized\nperson.
Rather than things being put away, it was more\nlike they were stuffed in.
'Oh, here it is! This is it!'
The thing that Amane had taken out was a paper\nairplane construction kit made using cardboard.
'OK, try to make one.'
Without thinking, Kotori and I looked at each\nother.
I feel that manufacturing a glider and making a\npaper airplane are completely different things.
But for now, I'll try doing as she says.
Using glue and a craft knife, in about ten\nminutes, we had finished the paper plane.
'Finished.'
'All done.'
Amane takes the plane that Kotori had made and\ntakes a good look at it.
Then, she threw it.
The paper airplane floated gently as it flew and\nlanded near the wall on the other side of the\ngarage.
'It flew straight forward very nicely. It's a\ngood plane.'
Kotori seems embarrassed at being complimented.
'There are many types of airplanes. There are\nJumbo jets, small Cessnas, fighter planes...'
'Then there are paper airplanes, like the one you\njust threw...'
'But all of them fly based on the same\nprinciple.'
'...Paper airplanes and Jumbo jets are the same?'
'Yes, the principles are the same. Using their\nwings to float on the air, in order to fly.'
Kotori and I both tilted our heads in puzzlement.
We both had a skeptical look on our faces.

I can understand that a light paper airplane can
fly by riding the wind, but it's hard to imagine
that a giant hunk of metal can float in the sky
on the same principle.
There must be some other method that allows it to\nfly.
Amane goes to pick up the paper airplane that she\nhad just thrown.
'I'd like you to take a good look. Can the two of\nyou see what the difference is between this\nairplane and this paper one?'
'The size and the material?'
'Also, whether or not people ride on it.'
'That's right. Then there is whether or not it\nhas an engine.'
'On the other hand, everything is the same. Here\nwe have the principles of flight.'
'Regular airplanes are made from mostly the same\nparts as this.'
'First, there's the body.'
'Next are the main wings.'
'The horizontal tailplane.'
'The vertical tailplane.'

'There are a few airplanes that have a somewhat
quirky shape, but even in those cases, they still
have mostly the same parts, or other parts that
fulfill a similar role.'
When she puts it like that, I guess she's right.\nI've never paid that much attention to it though.
'By the way, do you know how an airplane floats\non the air?'
'Because it has lift.'

'That's right. Like the force of a fluid moving
over a wing, lift is said to be the vertical
component in accordance with the direction of the
flow.'
I look baffled again and Amane smiles a little\nand rephrases it.
'In other words, it's the force that makes the\nwings float up on the air.'
'Lift is created here... on the main wings.'
'When air hits the wings from the front, the air\nflow divides, going over and under the wings.'
I can just imagine the wings cutting the air like\na blade.

'At that time, there is a difference in the speed
of the airflow above and below the wing, and the
pressure drops on the side that has the faster
airflow.'
'That's Bernoulli's theorem.'
Amane nods.
Standing beside her, I am a little freaked out as\nshe easily comes out with a word like\n'Bernoulli'!!
What the hell is that?
'We were taught that in class, right?'
'We didn't learn that at my school.'
...Maybe.

'That's why the airplane's wings are designed so
that the air flows faster on the upper side. This
is in order to lower the pressure on the upper
side.'
'By doing this, the pressure on the lower side is\nhigher in comparison, and then the air lifts the\nwings up.'
'The air lifts the wings up...'
It's a phenomenon that is hard to suddenly\nimagine.
'So, that's Bernoulli's theorem?'
Amane nodded as if to say 'Yes.
'There's one more thing. The air flowing over the\ntop of the wing, bends downwards because of the\nwing's surface, causing downforce behind it.'
As she explains, Amane is drawing a cross section\nof a wing.
According to that, an airplane's wings are flat\nat the bottom and shaped like a mountain at the\ntop, so it seems like it's semi-circular.
Apparently, the air on the upper side flows along\nthe raised curved surface, and then bends to flow\ndownwards.
As for why the air flows along the raised\nsurface, it can assumed that this is because of\nthe nature of the air.
...Or so it would seem.
'This downforce, according to Newton's third law,\ncauses the same reaction on the wing, which lifts\nit in an upward direction.'
'The reaction lifts up the wing...??'
'When a heavy basketball hits the ground, doesn't\nit seem that it's floating weightlessly?'
'It's the same as that.'
Does that mean that when the wing 'drops' in the\nair, the reaction causes it to float?
'So when the lift exceeds the weight of the\nairplane, the airplane can fly through the air.'
'For example, it's the same for a Jumbo passenger\nairliner with a total weight of several hundred\ntons.'

Theoretically, that may be so, but I still
couldn't imagine how enough lift could be
generated to allow a several hundred ton airplane
to take off.
However, airplanes do actually fly in the sky.
'The main wings that create the lift are the\nparts necessary to make the airplane fly in the\nsky.'
I don't know if I understand or not.
However, I understood that the main wings are the\nmost important part.
'Next are the tailplanes, of which there are two\ntypes, vertical and horizontal.'
'These are added to stabilize the position of the\nairplane when in midair.'
'An airplane floats in midair, which is much more\nunstable than we humans are when standing on the\nground.'
'The one going straight up is the vertical\ntailplane. This stabilizes lateral movement.'
'The ones extending out sideways, the same as the\nmain wings, are the horizontal tailplanes.'
'These move vertically, in other words,\nstabilizing the up and down movements of the\nnose.'
'Without this, even a paper airplane won't fly\nstraight.'
I see. So that's why they have small wings on the\ntail.
'Then there's the body.'
'This doesn't have a direct relationship to\nflight.'
But if you don't have this, there is nowhere to\nattach the wings.
'And that is the basic form of an airplane.'
'That hasn't changed since a looooong time ago,\nsince the era of the Wright brothers.'
'Since that long ago!?'
'But the Wright brothers were the first people in\nthe world to fly a plane, right?'
So nothing has changed since the very first one\nwas made?
'The Wright brothers were the first to fly using\npowered flight. Gliders were being flown even\nbefore that.'
'Yeah, I guess so...'
I always thought that the Wright brothers were\nthe first to fly.
'If you know the role of the wings, you should\ntry it on this paper airplane.'
'For example, if you were to bend the vertical\ntailplane a little... like this!'
The plane that Amane threw curved gently as it\nflew.
'Also, if you curve this part of the main wings a\nlittle...'
She bent the left and right main wings so that\nthey twisted at the back.
This time, the plane twisted as it flew.
'Hey, that's pretty interesting.'
Seeing this, Kotori started to adjust the\ntailplane on her own paper airplane.
'Watch this!'
Full of confidence, Kotori threw her paper\nairplane...
'Whoa!'
It did a beautiful loop-the-loop before landing.
'That's cool, it did a loop-the-loop!'
'This paper airplane is really interesting!'
Kotori and I both got really engrossed in\nadjusting the wings and playing around.
Sometimes, the paper airplanes displayed some\nmidair aerobatics, and other times, they didn't\nfly at all and crashed into the ground.
However, by trying it for ourselves, we were able\nto get a real understanding of the role of the\nwings.
'By just changing the shape of the wings a\nlittle, you can make them fly in many different\nways.'
'Actual airplanes have many smaller wings, such\nas ailerons. The aircraft is controlled by\nadjusting them.'
As she explained, Amane moved to the side of the\ngarage.
Then she lovingly laid her hand on the glider.
'This glider doesn't have an engine.'
'It is like a bigger and more robust paper\nairplane; the only thing that has been added is\nthe cockpit.'
Kotori and I looked at the paper airplanes in our\nhands.
I imagine riding it and flying through the sky.
This is just like the fantasies I envisioned as a\nkid.
The glider in front of me was the real thing.
'How about it, you just felt like you could make\none, didn't you?'
'But it doesn't have an engine. How does it fly?'
Paper airplanes gain thrust by being thrown by\npeople.
'By riding the wind.'
Both I and Kotori gaze at the white aircraft.
That day, we saw this flying from Windmill Hill.
Riding the wind... That expression expresses it\nso perfectly, the way it flew so smoothly and\ncalmly.
'Riding the wind...'
Amane nods happily.
'Then, by riding rising air currents, you can fly\nanywhere!'
'Anywhere?'
'Yes. You can even go above the clouds.'
'Above the clouds...'
Kotori looked at the aircraft with an expression\nof disbelief.
I also couldn't imagine this thing flying above\nthe clouds.
'Have you been there? Above the clouds?'
'Well...that's ah...'
Suddenly, her mood drops.
'I only put it together recently, and finally\ntook it out on a test flight...'
'(It was that time!)'
Kotori and I react by exchanging glances.
'The wings weren't strong enough and snapped\nhalfway through.'
'So, you mean...'
'Yeah, it was pretty dangerous. If they had\nbroken completely, I might have fallen to my\ndeath in the lake.'
'Ah ha ha ha ha!' she laughed as she spoke.
'I have to rebuild them. It's because I'm not so\ngood with my hands.'
'Also, I know some of the instruments are broken\nbut I'm having trouble getting my hands on the\nparts.'
'Why don't you make them yourself?'

Kotori said that so easily. At a school where
things like this are taught, they have all the
equipment you need to make anything, from a screw
to an aircraft.
'That's no good either...'
Amane, with a troubled look on her face, took\nsome broken parts from a drawer.
'The diaphragm is one of the parts used to make\nthe airspeed controller.'
'This was a special order and the factory where\nthis was made shut down a long time ago.'
Kotori and I gaze at the parts in the palm of\nAmane's hand.
It certainly looks it wouldn't be easy to make...
'...If it's the kind of thing that can be made in\nthe town factory, there might be something that\ncan be done about it.'
Amane's eyes light up as I quietly mumble.
'Really?'
'Ah, well, I don't know until I ask but... I know\nsomeone like that.'
'Please! If I don't have this, I'll be in a real\nfix!'
'OK, I'll try asking next time I see him. Can I\nborrow this?'
'Thank you, this will be the third time you've\nsaved me...'
FWOOSH!
'Whoooah!!'
Suddenly, she gives me a full-on hug and we're\neven cheek-to-cheek.
'Thank you thank you!'
'Erk... You can thank me once I've actually got\nit!'
'Oh yes, I guess you're right. But this includes\nthe thanks for lunch!'
'So let me express my thanks one more time!'
'No, that's enough, seriously!'
'Really?'
Kotori was sullenly glaring at me.
'I wonder if this will really fly...'
Kotori and I both gaze at the glider with the\nsame look on our faces.
'By the way, you two...'
'If you're interested in gliders...Umm...ah...'
The bell rings, interrupting Amane.
Amane flinches in surprise and quickly turns her\nback to us.
'If we're interested... what is it?'
'No, it's nothing, forget about it!'
Somehow, it seems she's avoiding something.
'Amane?'
'What?'
'Can I come and see you again?'
'Yeah, of course. If you're interested, come any\ntime.'
I have to bring her those parts as well.
'You too.'
'Come again.'
As Kotori nods, Amane grins as she nods back.
She's really beautiful but her smile somehow\nmakes her look like a little kid.
'Alright, shall we go back to the classroom?'
I started pushing Kotori's wheelchair and decided\nto start walking.
'Hey, where are you taking me!?'
'The classroom, of course!'
'No, stop! I'm hungry and I haven't had lunch\nyet!'
'You reap what you sow.'
'I said stop, hey! Don't push me!'
I brought Kotori with me against her wishes and\nwe returned to the classroom.
'Aoi!'
I went back to the dormitory, and someone called\nout to me when I was at the gate.
'Aoi!'
'An-chan!'
When I saw who it was, my level of enthusiasm\nwent up by 500 percent.
Standing there was An-chan.
'I was thinking about going to see you tomorrow\nor something!'
'I wanted to meet you soon, so I skipped work to\ncome here.'
'It's been a long time, Aoi!'
An-chan ruffles my hair.
'Hey, stop that will ya!?'
Completely ignoring my attempts to resist,\nAn-chan gives me a noogie, grinding my hair round\nand round.
I think that my hair is probably messed up pretty\nbadly now.
This is Tatsuya Igarashi.
Commonly known as An-chan.
He's a childhood friend of Ageha and mine and is\nlike a real big brother to us.
He's much older than us but we used to play\ntogether a lot as kids.
'Aw...geez! You're messing up my hair!'
'Ha ha ha! Sorry! When I remembered the past, I\ncouldn't help it!'
'You haven't changed either, An-chan. Still the\nsame as before.'
'Hey, hey! That's not a compliment, is it?'
'Oh isn't it?'
'Of course. People can't get stuck in a rut.\nPeople change, you know?'
What An-chan says is true, but personally, I'd\nrather him stay the way he is now.
As I think about that, An-chan all of a sudden\nhas a kind look on his face.
'Is your leg OK now?'
'Yeah, well...enough for everyday life.'
'I see.'
'It must've been tough.'
'It's no big deal. I can have a normal life like\nthis.'
'On top of that, I had you there to watch me in\nthe race where I tried the hardest.'
'That was a good race. You looked pretty cool\nwhen you were on the podium!'
'I came third though.'
I was in the Cycle Racing Club at my last school.
During the final race of my freshman year, I\nmanaged to win third place -- a spot on the\npodium.
It was my greatest achievement.
For that race, An-chan traveled a long way to\ncome and watch me.
'Third place is still amazing.'
'Yeah...'
Because of An-chan's kindness, I felt a little\ntearful.
He sensed how I was feeling and started to mess\nup my hair again.
This time it wasn't so rough.
'So now you're the dorm mother of this place,\nhuh?'
'Yeah.'
'The Flying Fish Manor. That brings back\nmemories...'
'We used to play here a lot. We would come\nsneaking in.'
'Huh? Oh yeah, that's right!'
That wasn't what An-chan was talking about just\nnow?
'By the way, is that girl a boarder here?'
Someone was hiding in the shadow of the gate.
'Kotori.'
It looked like she couldn't get past because\nAn-chan and I were in the way.
She could've just spoke to us normally, but\ninstead, she was hiding and watching us.
'Hello there, missy.'
'...H...hello.'
Kotori was still being cautious but returned the\ngreeting.
Then we got out of her way, then she went into\nher 'composed mode' and entered the dormitory.
'So that girl lives here, huh?'
'You know her?'
'Yeah. I see her in the town from time to time.'
'There's a big dog near my factory, you know?'
'Uh... Pedigree?'
There is a big dog that goes by that name.
I'm sure it was a Saint Bernard.
'Yesterday, she was hanging around near\nPedigree.'
'Was she by any chance trying to stroke his\nhead?'
'Yeah, that's what it looked like. She was giving\nhim food but that dog only eats food from his\nowner.'
As I thought.
'That was in the 'Things I want to do' list.

*Stroke the head of the big dog in the
neighborhood. (it's really scary but it might be
unexpectedly friendly. If possible, I'd like to
ride around on its back.)
'(So she was skipping school to go and do things\nlike that...?)'
Well, I'll forget about Kotori for now.
'Anyways, welcome back, Aoi.'
'It's good to be back, An-chan.'
I seemed a little embarrassed as I answered and\nAn-chan grinned at me.
'If you have any problems, don't hesitate to ask.\nI'm your big bro, right?'
Parting with those words, An-chan turned to\nleave.
'Oh, that's right! An-chan!'
'I know this is a bit soon, but I have a favor to\nask.'
I took the parts that Amane had left with me out\nof my bag.
Along with it, was a memo with the dimensions and\nso on written down.
'I need some parts that are the same as these.\nWould you be able to get one?'
An-chan's family run a factory.
It's known as a 'town factory' and it seems that\nthey manufacture special order-made parts.
An-chan works there right now.
If An-chan can't do it, he might be able to use\nhis connections with other engineers to introduce\nme to other factories.
An-chan looks at the broken parts and the memo...
'A diaphragm, huh? ...Yeah, OK.'
he quickly answered.
'I'll contact you once I get my hands on it.'
'Thanks, An-chan.'
'No problem.'
An-chan raised one hand and turned to leave.
Thanks to the fact that I was able to meet\nAn-chan, I went back to my room in a good mood.
I put my hand on the saddle of the bicycle in the\ncorner of my room.
I'm proud to have been able to stand on the\npodium in front of a buddy like An-chan.
'That looks like an expensive bike.'
Before I realized, Kotori was next to me.
'...What are you doing here?'
'I came in here with you, didn't you realize?'
I hadn't realized.
'Do you want something?'
Without answering my question, Kotori opened a\ndrawer in the desk.
'In here! ...Maybe not.'
'How about in here...?'
It looks like she's searching for something.
'Not here... That's strange, I was sure that\nyou'd have it.'
There was nothing that I didn't want her to see,\nso I was unfazed when I questioned her.
'What are you doing?'
'...Looking for something. You can see that,\ncan't you?'
'I know but shouldn't you at least get the\nconsent of the owner of the room?'
'What about you? Give it back now! I know you've\ngot it!'
'Got what?'
Apparently, she was looking for the withdrawal\nnotice that I had picked up before.
'I don't know what you're looking for, but I\ndon't think it's in here.'
'...You definitely sound suspicious. There's no\nmistaking it, I know you have it.'
'Did you say something?'
'No.'
It looked like her search came to a close.
Kotori didn't leave the room, however, opting to\nkeep looking around instead.
'...This is the first time I've been in a boy's\nroom.'
'It's pretty tidy, isn't it? I expected... trash\neverywhere.'
'I don't have a lot of stuff.'
Thanks to that, moving was easy.
Kotori was staring straight at the bike, which\nhad a unique presence in my room.
'What happened to your leg?'
I panicked at being asked so frankly.
'I...it's no big deal.'
Looks like she was listening to my conversation\nwith An-chan.
'I just had a bit of an injury. But look, it's\nfine now.'
I lightly swing my leg to show her.
'Is the injury the reason why you changed\nschool?'
'It's fine, really. Why do you ask?'
'No reason. I just felt like it.'
'...There's no need for you to worry about it.'
'Wh...who said I was worried about you? I'm not\nworried, not even a tiny bit.'
'See you later. That was a waste of time.'
Kotori makes a straight face and goes back to her\nroom.
'You're going again tomorrow, aren't you?'
'To the garage. At lunch.'
I'm not going!
is what it felt like she was going to say.
'I am going!'
she answered, and panicked as she left my room.
'Looks like I should make three lunchboxes this\ntime.'
